description.narrative: Finans- och infrastrukturministeriet ställde en förfrågan om stöd för att förbättra Chisinaus el- och värmeleverantörs arbete. För att göra detta genomfördes en studie om teknisk revision, hydraulisk beräkning, energimodellering och tillgångsutveckling av Termoelectricas värme- och krafttillgångar i Chisinaus kommun. Den genomförande partnern är Världsbanken, som har gedigen erfarenhet av Republiken Moldaviens energisektor. För att undvika etablerandet av nya trustfonder kommer Avtalet om energisektorns hanteringsassistansprogram (Energy Sector Management Assistance Programme; ESMAP) ändras för att inkludera stödet till fjärrvärmestudien. Mot slutet av insatsen kommer förmånstagarna att ha en energimodell baserad på kraftverksprestanda. Modellen kommer troligtvis att användas av Termoelectrica för att förbättra sin verksamhet.

Finans- och infrastrukturministeriet ställde en förfrågan om stöd för att förbättra Chisinaus el- och värmeleverantörs arbete. För att göra detta genomfördes en studie om teknisk revision, hydraulisk beräkning, energimodellering och tillgångsutveckling av Termoelectricas värme- och krafttillgångar i Chisinaus kommun.
Den genomförande partnern är Världsbanken, som har gedigen erfarenhet av Republiken Moldaviens energisektor. För att undvika etablerandet av nya trustfonder kommer Avtalet om energisektorns hanteringsassistansprogram (Energy Sector Management Assistance Programme; ESMAP) ändras för att inkludera stödet till fjärrvärmestudien.
Mot slutet av insatsen kommer förmånstagarna att ha en energimodell baserad på kraftverksprestanda. Modellen kommer troligtvis att användas av Termoelectrica för att förbättra sin verksamhet.

The Ministry of Economy and Infrastructure kindly asked for support in improving the work of the electricity and heating supplier of Chisinau. In order to do so, a study on Technical Audit, Hydraulic calculation, Energy Modelling and Assets Development of Termoelectrica's heat and Power Assets in Chisinau Municipality will be conducted.
The implementing partner is the World Bank, which has extensive experience in the energy sector in the Republic of Moldova. In order to avoid opening new Trust Funds, the Agreement on the Energy Sector Management Assistance Programe (ESMAP) Trust Fund will be ammended in order to include the support for the district heating study.
By the end of the intervention the beneficiaries will have an energy model based on the plant performance characteristics. The model is likely to used by "Termoelectrica" in order to optimize its operation.

participating-org.narrative: IBRD/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank

title.narrative: Decision on Contribution District Heating Study

description.narrative: DH Optimization Study – Component 1 Since the previous reporting in March 2019, the consultants led by the World Bank team executed important and significant work and completed the Study by its current deadline of February 28, 2020. The initial findings and recommendations of the technical reports on DH system’s technical audit, hydraulics, energy modeling, and assets development with indicative projected investments were presented to the Client in a working level technical workshop on March 21, 2019. Presentation of the Draft Assets Development and Financing and Investment Plan and the draft Energy Model and the Technical-economic Model were made to Termoelectrica, incorporating the inputs from the technical reports and feedback received in March workshop. This triggered significant additional requests from TE to Consultants to expand the scope of work and increase in the analysis the number of potential scenarios. Eighteen scenarios in total were analyzed. The investment priorities, outlined in the Study around secure heat/electricity production and increase in production efficiency, are considered by the Ministry of Economy and Infrastructure as affordable and feasible. The total estimated cost of the investment package, based on the study’s results, amounts to USD 85.6 mln. The Draft Final Report including the key conclusions and recommendations as well as the detailed short-, mid- and long-term investment plan have been presented in a workshop in Chisinau on October 7, 2019 with participation by Termoelectrica, Ministry of Economy and Infrastructure in charge of Energy and its Moldovan Energy Project Implementation Unit, Ministry of Finance, the national energy regulator- ANRE, the development partners such as EBRD, EIB, European Union Delegation to Moldova. Fuel (gas) Optimization Study – Component 2 The objective of the Fuel Supply Optimization Study is to analyze the current structure of the gas sector in Moldova, help better understand changes and developments of regional gas networks, and identify additional potential diversification to further improve the security and efficiency of gas supply. The consultant was hired on November 26 with some delay due to political changes in the country. The consultant embraced immediately on the task and completed Phase 1 report on immediate solutions to ensure Moldova’s gas supply on December 24, 2019. The report is of very high quality and acceptable to the Bank. It serves as good basis for the Phase 2 work to identify the strategic options for diversification of gas supply to Moldova. The consultant is working on Phase 2 report. The 1st phase and feedback received from counterparts as well as the rapidly changing geo-political environment and economic realities of gas supplies in the region, revealed the need for more in-depth analysis of possible solutions and additional visits to the country for discussions with counterparts. This is also massively driven by rapidly evolving situation with Russia – Ukraine gas talks, specifically, transit on the Transbalkanik route, which could severely affect Moldova in the near future. Additional timing is also necessary for proper dialogue and dissemination of Study’s findings and recommendations.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
